segment_text: On glancing over my notes of the seventy odd cases in which I have during the last eight years studied the methods of my friend Sherlock Holmes, I find many tragic, some comic, a large number merely strange, but none commonplace;
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: for, working as he did rather for the love of his art than for the acquirement of wealth, he refused to associate himself with any investigation which did not tend towards the unusual, and even the fantastic.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: Of all these varied cases, however, I cannot recall any which presented more singular features than that which was associated with the well-known Surrey family of the Roylotts of Stoke Moran.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: The events in question occurred in the early days of my association with Holmes, when we were sharing rooms as bachelors in Baker Street.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: It is possible that I might have placed them upon record before, but a promise of secrecy was made at the time, from which I have only been freed during the last month by the untimely death of the lady to whom the pledge was given.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: It is perhaps as well that the facts should now come to light, for I have reasons to know that there are widespread rumours as to the death of Dr. Grimesby Roylott which tend to make the matter even more terrible than the truth.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian study, cluttered desk, scattered notes

segment_text: It was early in April in the year ’83 that I woke one morning to find Sherlock Holmes standing, fully dressed, by the side of my bed.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian bedroom, dim morning light, mantelpiece clock

segment_text: He was a late riser, as a rule, and as the clock on the mantelpiece showed me that it was only a quarter-past seven, I blinked up at him in some surprise, and perhaps just a little resentment, for I was myself regular in my habits.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian bedroom, dim morning light, mantelpiece clock

segment_text: “Very sorry to knock you up, Watson,” said he, “but it’s the common lot this morning. Mrs. Hudson has been knocked up, she retorted upon me, and I on you.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian bedroom, dim morning light, mantelpiece clock

segment_text: “What is it, then—a fire?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “No; a client. It seems that a young lady has arrived in a considerable state of excitement, who insists upon seeing me. She is waiting now in the sitting-room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Now, when young ladies wander about the metropolis at this hour of the morning, and knock sleepy people up out of their beds, I presume that it is something very pressing which they have to communicate.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Should it prove to be an interesting case, you would, I am sure, wish to follow it from the outset. I thought, at any rate, that I should call you and give you the chance.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “My dear fellow, I would not miss it for anything.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I had no keener pleasure than in following Holmes in his professional investigations, and in admiring the rapid deductions, as swift as intuitions, and yet always founded on a logical basis with which he unravelled the problems which were submitted to him.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I rapidly threw on my clothes and was ready in a few minutes to accompany my friend down to the sitting-room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: A lady dressed in black and heavily veiled, who had been sitting in the window, rose as we entered.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Good-morning, madam,” said Holmes cheerily. “My name is Sherlock Holmes. This is my intimate friend and associate, Dr. Watson, before whom you can speak as freely as before myself.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Ha! I am glad to see that Mrs. Hudson has had the good sense to light the fire. Pray draw up to it, and I shall order you a cup of hot coffee, for I observe that you are shivering.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It is not cold which makes me shiver,” said the woman in a low voice, changing her seat as requested.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “What, then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It is fear, Mr. Holmes. It is terror.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: She raised her veil as she spoke, and we could see that she was indeed in a pitiable state of agitation, her face all drawn and grey, with restless frightened eyes, like those of some hunted animal.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Her features and figure were those of a woman of thirty, but her hair was shot with premature grey, and her expression was weary and haggard.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes ran her over with one of his quick, all-comprehensive glances.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “You must not fear,” said he soothingly, bending forward and patting her forearm. “We shall soon set matters right, I have no doubt. You have come in by train this morning, I see.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “You know me, then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “No, but I observe the second half of a return ticket in the palm of your left glove. You must have started early, and yet you had a good drive in a dog-cart, along heavy roads, before you reached the station.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The lady gave a violent start and stared in bewilderment at my companion.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “There is no mystery, my dear madam,” said he, smiling. “The left arm of your jacket is spattered with mud in no less than seven places. The marks are perfectly fresh.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: There is no vehicle save a dog-cart which throws up mud in that way, and then only when you sit on the left-hand side of the driver.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Whatever your reasons may be, you are perfectly correct,” said she. “I started from home before six, reached Leatherhead at twenty past, and came in by the first train to Waterloo.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Sir, I can stand this strain no longer; I shall go mad if it continues. I have no one to turn to—none, save only one, who cares for me, and he, poor fellow, can be of little aid.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I have heard of you, Mr. Holmes; I have heard of you from Mrs. Farintosh, whom you helped in the hour of her sore need. It was from her that I had your address.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Oh, sir, do you not think that you could help me, too, and at least throw a little light through the dense darkness which surrounds me?
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: At present it is out of my power to reward you for your services, but in a month or six weeks I shall be married, with the control of my own income, and then at least you shall not find me ungrateful.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Holmes turned to his desk and, unlocking it, drew out a small case-book, which he consulted.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Farintosh,” said he. “Ah yes, I recall the case; it was concerned with an opal tiara. I think it was before your time, Watson.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I can only say, madam, that I shall be happy to devote the same care to your case as I did to that of your friend. As to reward, my profession is its own reward; but you are at liberty to defray whatever expenses I may be put to, at the time which suits you best.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: And now I beg that you will lay before us everything that may help us in forming an opinion upon the matter.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Alas!” replied our visitor, “the very horror of my situation lies in the fact that my fears are so vague, and my suspicions depend so entirely upon small points, which might seem trivial to another, that even he to whom of all others I have a right to look for help and advice looks upon all that I tell him about it as the fancies of a nervous woman.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: He does not say so, but I can read it from his soothing answers and averted eyes. But I have heard, Mr. Holmes, that you can see deeply into the manifold wickedness of the human heart.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: You may advise me how to walk amid the dangers which encompass me.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I am all attention, madam.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “My name is Helen Stoner, and I am living with my stepfather, who is the last survivor of one of the oldest Saxon families in England, the Roylotts of Stoke Moran, on the western border of Surrey.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Holmes nodded his head. “The name is familiar to me,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “The family was at one time among the richest in England, and the estates extended over the borders into Berkshire in the north, and Hampshire in the west.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: In the last century, however, four successive heirs were of a dissolute and wasteful disposition, and the family ruin was eventually completed by a gambler in the days of the Regency.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Nothing was left save a few acres of ground, and the two-hundred-year-old house, which is itself crushed under a heavy mortgage.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The last squire dragged out his existence there, living the horrible life of an aristocratic pauper; but his only son, my stepfather, seeing that he must adapt himself to the new conditions, obtained an advance from a relative, which enabled him to take a medical degree and went out to Calcutta, where, by his professional skill and his force of character, he established a large practice.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: In a fit of anger, however, caused by some robberies which had been perpetrated in the house, he beat his native butler to death and narrowly escaped a capital sentence.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: As it was, he suffered a long term of imprisonment and afterwards returned to England a morose and disappointed man.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “When Dr. Roylott was in India he married my mother, Mrs. Stoner, the young widow of Major-General Stoner, of the Bengal Artillery. My sister Julia and I were twins, and we were only two years old at the time of my mother’s re-marriage.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: She had a considerable sum of money—not less than £ 1000 a year—and this she bequeathed to Dr. Roylott entirely while we resided with him, with a provision that a certain annual sum should be allowed to each of us in the event of our marriage.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Shortly after our return to England my mother died—she was killed eight years ago in a railway accident near Crewe.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Dr. Roylott then abandoned his attempts to establish himself in practice in London and took us to live with him in the old ancestral house at Stoke Moran. The money which my mother had left was enough for all our wants, and there seemed to be no obstacle to our happiness.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “But a terrible change came over our stepfather about this time. Instead of making friends and exchanging visits with our neighbours, who had at first been overjoyed to see a Roylott of Stoke Moran back in the old family seat, he shut himself up in his house and seldom came out save to indulge in ferocious quarrels with whoever might cross his path.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Violence of temper approaching to mania has been hereditary in the men of the family, and in my stepfather’s case it had, I believe, been intensified by his long residence in the tropics.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: A series of disgraceful brawls took place, two of which ended in the police-court, until at last he became the terror of the village, and the folks would fly at his approach, for he is a man of immense strength, and absolutely uncontrollable in his anger.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Last week he hurled the local blacksmith over a parapet into a stream, and it was only by paying over all the money which I could gather together that I was able to avert another public exposure.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: He had no friends at all save the wandering gipsies, and he would give these vagabonds leave to encamp upon the few acres of bramble-covered land which represent the family estate, and would accept in return the hospitality of their tents, wandering away with them sometimes for weeks on end.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: He has a passion also for Indian animals, which are sent over to him by a correspondent, and he has at this moment a cheetah and a baboon, which wander freely over his grounds and are feared by the villagers almost as much as their master.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “You can imagine from what I say that my poor sister Julia and I had no great pleasure in our lives. No servant would stay with us, and for a long time we did all the work of the house.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: She was but thirty at the time of her death, and yet her hair had already begun to whiten, even as mine has.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Your sister is dead, then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “She died just two years ago, and it is of her death that I wish to speak to you. You can understand that, living the life which I have described, we were little likely to see anyone of our own age and position.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: We had, however, an aunt, my mother’s maiden sister, Miss Honoria Westphail, who lives near Harrow, and we were occasionally allowed to pay short visits at this lady’s house.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Julia went there at Christmas two years ago, and met there a half-pay major of marines, to whom she became engaged.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: My stepfather learned of the engagement when my sister returned and offered no objection to the marriage; but within a fortnight of the day which had been fixed for the wedding, the terrible event occurred which has deprived me of my only companion.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes had been leaning back in his chair with his eyes closed and his head sunk in a cushion, but he half opened his lids now and glanced across at his visitor.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Pray be precise as to details,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It is easy for me to be so, for every event of that dreadful time is seared into my memory. The manor-house is, as I have already said, very old, and only one wing is now inhabited.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The bedrooms in this wing are on the ground floor, the sitting-rooms being in the central block of the buildings. Of these bedrooms the first is Dr. Roylott’s, the second my sister’s, and the third my own.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: There is no communication between them, but they all open out into the same corridor. Do I make myself plain?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Perfectly so.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “The windows of the three rooms open out upon the lawn. That fatal night Dr. Roylott had gone to his room early, though we knew that he had not retired to rest, for my sister was troubled by the smell of the strong Indian cigars which it was his custom to smoke.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: She left her room, therefore, and came into mine, where she sat for some time, chatting about her approaching wedding. At eleven o’clock she rose to leave me, but she paused at the door and looked back.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Tell me, Helen,’ said she, ‘have you ever heard anyone whistle in the dead of the night?’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Never,’ said I.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘I suppose that you could not possibly whistle, yourself, in your sleep?’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Certainly not. But why?’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Because during the last few nights I have always, about three in the morning, heard a low, clear whistle. I am a light sleeper, and it has awakened me.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I cannot tell where it came from—perhaps from the next room, perhaps from the lawn. I thought that I would just ask you whether you had heard it.’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘No, I have not. It must be those wretched gipsies in the plantation.’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Very likely. And yet if it were on the lawn, I wonder that you did not hear it also.’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Ah, but I sleep more heavily than you.’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “‘Well, it is of no great consequence, at any rate.’ She smiled back at me, closed my door, and a few moments later I heard her key turn in the lock.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Indeed,” said Holmes. “Was it your custom always to lock yourselves in at night?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Always.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “And why?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I think that I mentioned to you that the Doctor kept a cheetah and a baboon. We had no feeling of security unless our doors were locked.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Quite so. Pray proceed with your statement.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I could not sleep that night. A vague feeling of impending misfortune impressed me.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: My sister and I, you will recollect, were twins, and you know how subtle are the links which bind two souls which are so closely allied. It was a wild night.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The wind was howling outside, and the rain was beating and splashing against the windows. Suddenly, amid all the hubbub of the gale, there burst forth the wild scream of a terrified woman.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I knew that it was my sister’s voice. I sprang from my bed, wrapped a shawl round me, and rushed into the corridor.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: As I opened my door I seemed to hear a low whistle, such as my sister described, and a few moments later a clanging sound, as if a mass of metal had fallen.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: As I ran down the passage, my sister’s door was unlocked, and revolved slowly upon its hinges. I stared at it horror-stricken, not knowing what was about to issue from it.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: By the light of the corridor-lamp I saw my sister appear at the opening, her face blanched with terror, her hands groping for help, her whole figure swaying to and fro like that of a drunkard.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I ran to her and threw my arms round her, but at that moment her knees seemed to give way and she fell to the ground. She writhed as one who is in terrible pain, and her limbs were dreadfully convulsed.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: At first I thought that she had not recognised me, but as I bent over her she suddenly shrieked out in a voice which I shall never forget, ‘Oh, my God! Helen! It was the band! The speckled band!’
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: There was something else which she would fain have said, and she stabbed with her finger into the air in the direction of the Doctor’s room, but a fresh convulsion seized her and choked her words.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I rushed out, calling loudly for my stepfather, and I met him hastening from his room in his dressing-gown.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: When he reached my sister’s side she was unconscious, and though he poured brandy down her throat and sent for medical aid from the village, all efforts were in vain, for she slowly sank and died without having recovered her consciousness.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Such was the dreadful end of my beloved sister.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “One moment,” said Holmes, “are you sure about this whistle and metallic sound? Could you swear to it?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “That was what the county coroner asked me at the inquiry. It is my strong impression that I heard it, and yet, among the crash of the gale and the creaking of an old house, I may possibly have been deceived.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Was your sister dressed?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “No, she was in her night-dress. In her right hand was found the charred stump of a match, and in her left a match-box.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Showing that she had struck a light and looked about her when the alarm took place. That is important. And what conclusions did the coroner come to?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “He investigated the case with great care, for Dr. Roylott’s conduct had long been notorious in the county, but he was unable to find any satisfactory cause of death.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: My evidence showed that the door had been fastened upon the inner side, and the windows were blocked by old-fashioned shutters with broad iron bars, which were secured every night.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The walls were carefully sounded, and were shown to be quite solid all round, and the flooring was also thoroughly examined, with the same result. The chimney is wide, but is barred up by four large staples.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: It is certain, therefore, that my sister was quite alone when she met her end. Besides, there were no marks of any violence upon her.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “How about poison?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “The doctors examined her for it, but without success.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “What do you think that this unfortunate lady died of, then?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It is my belief that she died of pure fear and nervous shock, though what it was that frightened her I cannot imagine.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Were there gipsies in the plantation at the time?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Yes, there are nearly always some there.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Ah, and what did you gather from this allusion to a band—a speckled band?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Sometimes I have thought that it was merely the wild talk of delirium, sometimes that it may have referred to some band of people, perhaps to these very gipsies in the plantation.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I do not know whether the spotted handkerchiefs which so many of them wear over their heads might have suggested the strange adjective which she used.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Holmes shook his head like a man who is far from being satisfied.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “These are very deep waters,” said he; “pray go on with your narrative.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Two years have passed since then, and my life has been until lately lonelier than ever. A month ago, however, a dear friend, whom I have known for many years, has done me the honour to ask my hand in marriage.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: His name is Armitage—Percy Armitage—the second son of Mr. Armitage, of Crane Water, near Reading. My stepfather has offered no opposition to the match, and we are to be married in the course of the spring.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Two days ago some repairs were started in the west wing of the building, and my bedroom wall has been pierced, so that I have had to move into the chamber in which my sister died, and to sleep in the very bed in which she slept.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Imagine, then, my thrill of terror when last night, as I lay awake, thinking over her terrible fate, I suddenly heard in the silence of the night the low whistle which had been the herald of her own death.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I sprang up and lit the lamp, but nothing was to be seen in the room. I was too shaken to go to bed again, however, so I dressed, and as soon as it was daylight I slipped down, got a dog-cart at the Crown Inn, which is opposite, and drove to Leatherhead, from whence I have come on this morning with the one object of seeing you and asking your advice.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “You have done wisely,” said my friend. “But have you told me all?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Yes, all.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Miss Roylott, you have not. You are screening your stepfather.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Why, what do you mean?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: For answer Holmes pushed back the frill of black lace which fringed the hand that lay upon our visitor’s knee. Five little livid spots, the marks of four fingers and a thumb, were printed upon the white wrist.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “You have been cruelly used,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The lady coloured deeply and covered over her injured wrist. “He is a hard man,” she said, “and perhaps he hardly knows his own strength.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: There was a long silence, during which Holmes leaned his chin upon his hands and stared into the crackling fire.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “This is a very deep business,” he said at last. “There are a thousand details which I should desire to know before I decide upon our course of action. Yet we have not a moment to lose.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: If we were to come to Stoke Moran to-day, would it be possible for us to see over these rooms without знатьledge of your stepfather?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “As it happens, he spoke of coming into town to-day upon some most important business. It is probable that he will be away all day, and that there would be nothing to disturb you.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: We have a housekeeper now, but she is old and foolish, and I could easily get her out of the way.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Excellent. You are not averse to this trip, Watson?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “By no means.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Then we shall both come. What are you going to do yourself?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I have one or two things which I would wish to do now that I am in town. But I shall return by the twelve o’clock train, so as to be there in time for your coming.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “And you may expect us early in the afternoon. I have myself some small business matters to attend to. Will you not wait and breakfast?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “No, I must go. My heart is lightened already since I have confided my trouble to you. I shall look forward to seeing you again this afternoon.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: She dropped her thick black veil over her face and glided from the room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “And what do you think of it all, Watson?” asked Sherlock Holmes, leaning back in his chair.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It seems to me to be a most dark and sinister business.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Dark enough and sinister enough.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Yet if the lady is correct in saying that the flooring and walls are sound, and that the door, window, and chimney are impassable, then her sister must have been undoubtedly alone when she met her mysterious end.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “What becomes, then, of these nocturnal whistles, and what of the very peculiar words of the dying woman?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I cannot think.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “When you combine the ideas of whistles at night, the presence of a band of gipsies who are on intimate terms with this old doctor, the fact that we have every reason to believe that the doctor has an interest in preventing his stepdaughter’s marriage, the dying allusion to a band, and, finally, the fact that Miss Helen Stoner heard a metallic clang, which might have been caused by one of those metal bars that secured the shutters falling back into its place, I think that there is good ground to think that the mystery may be cleared along those lines.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “But what, then, did the gipsies do?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I cannot imagine.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I see many objections to any such theory.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “And so do I. It is precisely for that reason that we are going to Stoke Moran this day.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I want to see whether the objections are fatal, or if they may be explained away. But what in the name of the devil!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The ejaculation had been drawn from my companion by the fact that our door had been suddenly dashed open, and that a huge man had framed himself in the aperture.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: His costume was a peculiar mixture of the professional and of the agricultural, having a black top-hat, a long frock-coat, and a pair of high gaiters, with a hunting-crop swinging in his hand.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: So tall was he that his hat actually brushed the cross bar of the doorway, and his breadth seemed to span it across from side to side.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: A large face, seared with a thousand wrinkles, burned yellow with the sun, and marked with every evil passion, was turned from one to the other of us, while his deep-set, bile-shot eyes, and his high, thin, fleshless nose, gave him somewhat the resemblance to a fierce old bird of prey.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Which of you is Holmes?” asked this apparition.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “My name, sir; but you have the advantage of me,” said my companion quietly.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I am Dr. Grimesby Roylott, of Stoke Moran.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Indeed, Doctor,” said Holmes blandly. “Pray take a seat.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I will do nothing of the kind. My stepdaughter has been here. I have traced her. What has she been saying to you?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “It is a little cold for the time of the year,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “What has she been saying to you?” screamed the old man furiously.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “But I have heard that the crocuses promise well,” continued my companion imperturbably.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Ha! You put me off, do you?” said our new visitor, taking a step forward and shaking his hunting-crop. “I know you, you scoundrel! I have heard of you before. You are Holmes, the meddler.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: My friend smiled.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Holmes, the busybody!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: His smile broadened.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Holmes, the Scotland Yard Jack-in-office!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Holmes chuckled heartily. “Your conversation is most entertaining,”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: said he. “When you go out close the door, for there is a decided draught.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I will go when I have had my say. Don’t you dare to meddle with my affairs.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I know that Miss Stoner has been here. I traced her!
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I am a dangerous man to fall foul of! See here.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: He stepped swiftly forward, seized the poker, and bent it into a curve with his huge brown hands.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “See that you keep yourself out of my grip,” he snarled, and hurling the twisted poker into the fireplace he strode out of the room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “He seems a very amiable person,” said Holmes, laughing.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I am not quite so bulky, but if he had remained I might have shown him that my grip was not much more feeble than his own.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: As he spoke he picked up the steel poker and, with a sudden effort, straightened it out again.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “Fancy his having the insolence to confound me with the official detective force! This incident gives zest to our investigation, however, and I only trust that our little friend will not suffer from her imprudence in allowing this brute to trace her.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: And now, Watson, we shall order breakfast, and afterwards I shall walk down to Doctors’ Commons, where I hope to get some data which may help us in this matter.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: It was nearly one o’clock when Sherlock Holmes returned from his excursion. He held in his hand a sheet of blue paper, scrawled over with notes and figures.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: “I have seen the will of the deceased wife,” said he. “To determine its exact meaning I have been obliged to work out the present prices of the investments with which it is concerned.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: The total income, which at the time of the wife’s death was little short of £ 1,100, is now, through the fall in agricultural prices, not more than £ 750.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: Each daughter can claim an income of £ 250, in case of marriage. It is evident, therefore, that if both girls had married, this beauty would have had a mere pittance, while even one of them would cripple him to a very serious extent.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: My morning’s work has not been wasted, since it has proved that he has the very strongest motives for standing in the way of anything of the sort.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: And now, Watson, this is too serious for dawdling, especially as the old man is aware that we are interesting ourselves in his affairs; so if you are ready, we shall call a cab and drive to Waterloo.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: I should be very much obliged if you would slip your revolver into your pocket. An Eley’s No. 2 is an excellent argument with gentlemen who can twist steel pokers into knots.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: That and a tooth-brush are, I think, all that we need.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting-room, fireplace lit, veiled window

segment_text: At Waterloo we were fortunate in catching a train for Leatherhead,
scene_description: indoors, train station platform, train carriage interior, passing fields

segment_text: where we hired a trap at the station inn and drove for four or five miles through the lovely Surrey lanes.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: It was a perfect day, with a bright sun and a few fleecy clouds in the heavens.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: The trees and wayside hedges were just throwing out their first green shoots, and the air was full of the pleasant smell of the moist earth.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: To me at least there was a strange contrast between the sweet promise of the spring and this sinister quest upon which we were engaged.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: My companion sat in the front of the trap, his arms folded, his hat pulled down over his eyes, and his chin sunk upon his breast, buried in the deepest thought.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: Suddenly, however, he started, tapped me on the shoulder, and pointed over the meadows.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: “Look there!” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, horse-drawn trap, sunlit country lanes, spring hedgerows

segment_text: A heavily timbered park stretched up in a gentle slope, thickening into a grove at the highest point.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: From amid the branches there jutted out the grey gables and high roof-tree of a very old mansion.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “Stoke Moran?” said he.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “Yes, sir, that be the house of Dr. Grimesby Roylott,” remarked the driver.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “There is some building going on there,” said Holmes; “that is where we are going.”
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “There’s the village,” said the driver, pointing to a cluster of roofs some distance to the left; “but if you want to get to the house, you’ll find it shorter to get over this stile, and so by the footpath over the fields.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: There it is, where the lady is walking.”
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “And the lady, I fancy, is Miss Stoner,” observed Holmes, shading his eyes. “Yes, I think we had better do as you suggest.”
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: We got off, paid our fare, and the trap rattled back on its way to Leatherhead.
scene_description: outdoors, sunny meadows, wooden stile, distant gabled mansion

segment_text: “I thought it as well,” said Holmes as we climbed the stile, “that this fellow should think we had come here as architects, or on some definite business.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: It may stop his gossip. Good-afternoon, Miss Stoner.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: You see that we have been as good as our word.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Our client of the morning had hurried forward to meet us with a face which spoke her joy. “I have been waiting so eagerly for you,” she cried, shaking hands with us warmly.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “All has turned out splendidly. Dr. Roylott has gone to town, and it is unlikely that he will be back before evening.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “We have had the pleasure of making the Doctor’s acquaintance,” said Holmes, and in a few words he sketched out what had occurred.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Miss Stoner turned white to the lips as she listened.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Good heavens!” she cried, “he has followed me, then.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “So it appears.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “He is so cunning that I never know when I am safe from him. What will he say when he returns?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “He must guard himself, for he may find that there is someone more cunning than himself upon his track. You must lock yourself up from him to-night.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: If he is violent, we shall take you away to your aunt’s at Harrow. Now, we must make the best use of our time, so kindly take us at once to the rooms which we are to examine.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: The building was of grey, lichen-blotched stone, with a high central portion and two curving wings, like the claws of a crab, thrown out on each side.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: In one of these wings the windows were broken and blocked with wooden boards, while the roof was partly caved in, a picture of ruin.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: The central portion was in little better repair, but the right-hand block was comparatively modern, and the blinds in the windows, with the blue smoke curling up from the chimneys, showed that this was where the family resided.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Some scaffolding had been erected against the end wall, and the stone-work had been broken into, but there were no signs of any workmen at the moment of our visit.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Holmes walked slowly up and down the ill-trimmed lawn and examined with deep attention the outsides of the windows.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “This, I take it, belongs to the room in which you used to sleep, the centre one to your sister’s, and the one next to the main building to Dr. Roylott’s chamber?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Exactly so. But I am now sleeping in the middle one.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Pending the alterations, as I understand. By the way, there does not seem to be any very pressing need for repairs at that end wall.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “There were none. I believe that it was an excuse to move me from my room.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Ah! that is suggestive.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Now, on the other side of this narrow wing runs the corridor from which these three rooms open. There are windows in it, of course?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Yes, but very small ones. Too narrow for anyone to pass through.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “As you both locked your doors at night, your rooms were unapproachable from that side. Now, would you have the kindness to go into your room and bar your shutters?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Miss Stoner did so, and Holmes, after a careful examination through the open window, endeavoured in every way to force the shutter open, but without success.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: There was no slit through which a knife could be passed to raise the bar. Then with his lens he tested the hinges, but they were of solid iron, built firmly into the massive masonry.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Hum!” said he, scratching his chin in some perplexity, “my theory certainly presents some difficulties.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: No one could pass these shutters if they were bolted. Well, we shall see if the inside throws any light upon the matter.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: A small side door led into the whitewashed corridor from which the three bedrooms opened.
scene_description: indoors, whitewashed manor corridor, small high windows, panelled doors

segment_text: Holmes refused to examine the third chamber, so we passed at once to the second, that in which Miss Stoner was now sleeping, and in which her sister had met with her fate.
scene_description: indoors, whitewashed manor corridor, small high windows, panelled doors

segment_text: It was a homely little room, with a low ceiling and a gaping fireplace, after the fashion of old country-houses.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: A brown chest of drawers stood in one corner, a narrow white-counterpaned bed in another, and a dressing-table on the left-hand side of the window.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: These articles, with two small wicker-work chairs, made up all the furniture in the room save for a square of Wilton carpet in the centre.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: The boards round and the panelling of the walls were of brown, worm-eaten oak, so old and discoloured that it may have dated from the original building of the house.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Holmes drew one of the chairs into a corner and sat silent, while his eyes travelled round and round and up and down, taking in every detail of the apartment.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Where does that bell communicate with?” he asked at last pointing to a thick bell-rope which hung down beside the bed, the tassel actually lying upon the pillow.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “It goes to the housekeeper’s room.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “It looks newer than the other things?”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Yes, it was only put there a couple of years ago.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Your sister asked for it, I suppose?”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “No, I never heard of her using it. We used always to get what we wanted for ourselves.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Indeed, it seemed unnecessary to put so nice a bell-pull there. You will excuse me for a few minutes while I satisfy myself as to this floor.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: He threw himself down upon his face with his lens in his hand and crawled swiftly backward and forward, examining minutely the cracks between the boards.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Then he did the same with the wood-work with which the chamber was panelled. Finally he walked over to the bed and spent some time in staring at it and in running his eye up and down the wall.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Finally he took the bell-rope in his hand and gave it a brisk tug.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Why, it’s a dummy,” said he.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Won’t it ring?”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “No, it is not even attached to a wire. This is very interesting.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: You can see now that it is fastened to a hook just above where the little opening for the ventilator is.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “How very absurd! I never noticed that before.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Very strange!” muttered Holmes, pulling at the rope. “There are one or two very singular points about this room.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: For example, what a fool a builder must be to open a ventilator into another room, when, with the same trouble, he might have communicated with the outside air!”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “That is also quite modern,” said the lady.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Done about the same time as the bell-rope?” remarked Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Yes, there were several little changes carried out about that time.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “They seem to have been of a most interesting character—dummy bell-ropes, and ventilators which do not ventilate. With your permission, Miss Stoner, we shall now carry our researches into the inner apartment.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Dr. Grimesby Roylott’s chamber was larger than that of his step-daughter, but was as plainly furnished.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: A camp-bed, a small wooden shelf full of books, mostly of a technical character, an armchair beside the bed, a plain wooden chair against the wall, a round table, and a large iron safe were the principal things which met the eye.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Holmes walked slowly round and examined each and all of them with the keenest interest.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “What’s in here?” he asked, tapping the safe.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “My stepfather’s business papers.”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “Oh! you have seen inside, then?”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “Only once, some years ago. I remember that it was full of papers.”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “There isn’t a cat in it, for example?”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “No. What a strange idea!”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “Well, look at this!” He took up a small saucer of milk which stood on the top of it.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “No; we don’t keep a cat. But there is a cheetah and a baboon.”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “Ah, yes, of course! Well, a cheetah is just a big cat, and yet a saucer of milk does not go very far in satisfying its wants, I daresay.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: There is one point which I should wish to determine.” He squatted down in front of the wooden chair and examined the seat of it with the greatest attention.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “Thank you. That is quite settled,” said he, rising and putting his lens in his pocket. “Hullo! Here is something interesting!”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: The object which had caught his eye was a small dog lash hung on one corner of the bed. The lash, however, was curled upon itself and tied so as to make a loop of whipcord.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “What do you make of that, Watson?”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “It’s a common enough lash. But I don’t know why it should be tied.”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “That is not quite so common, is it? Ah, me! it’s a wicked world, and when a clever man turns his brains to crime it is the worst of all.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: I think that I have seen enough now, Miss Stoner, and with your permission we shall walk out upon the lawn.”
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: I had never seen my friend’s face so grim or his brow so dark as it was when we turned from the scene of this investigation.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: We had walked several times up and down the lawn, neither Miss Stoner nor myself liking to break in upon his thoughts before he roused himself from his reverie.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “It is very essential, Miss Stoner,” said he, “that you should absolutely follow my advice in every respect.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “I shall most certainly do so.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “The matter is too serious for any hesitation. Your life may depend upon your compliance.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “I assure you that I am in your hands.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “In the first place, both my friend and I must spend the night in your room.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Both Miss Stoner and I gazed at him in astonishment.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Yes, it must be so. Let me explain. I believe that that is the village inn over there?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Yes, that is the Crown.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Very good. Your windows would be visible from there?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Certainly.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “You must confine yourself to your room, on pretence of a headache, when your stepfather comes back. Then when you hear him retire for the night, you must open the shutters of your window, undo the hasp, put your lamp there as a signal to us, and then withdraw quietly with everything which you are likely to want into the room which you used to occupy.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: I have no doubt that, in spite of the repairs, you could manage there for one night.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Oh, yes, easily.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “The rest you will leave in our hands.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “But what will you do?”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “We shall spend the night in your room, and we shall investigate the cause of this noise which has disturbed you.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “I believe, Mr. Holmes, that you have already made up your mind,” said Miss Stoner, laying her hand upon my companion’s sleeve.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Perhaps I have.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “Then, for pity’s sake, tell me what was the cause of my sister’s death.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “I should prefer to have clearer proofs before I speak.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “You can at least tell me whether my own thought is correct, and if she died from some sudden fright.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: “No, I do not think so. I think that there was probably some more tangible cause.
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: And now, Miss Stoner, we must leave you for if Dr. Roylott returned and saw us our journey would be in vain. Good-bye, and be brave, for if you will do what I have told you, you may rest assured that we shall soon drive away the dangers that threaten you.”
scene_description: outdoors, lichen-blotched stone manor, ill-trimmed lawn, scaffolding

segment_text: Sherlock Holmes and I had no difficulty in engaging a bedroom and sitting-room at the Crown Inn.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: They were on the upper floor, and from our window we could command a view of the avenue gate, and of the inhabited wing of Stoke Moran Manor House.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: At dusk we saw Dr. Grimesby Roylott drive past, his huge form looming up beside the little figure of the lad who drove him.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: The boy had some slight difficulty in undoing the heavy iron gates, and we heard the hoarse roar of the Doctor’s voice and saw the fury with which he shook his clinched fists at him.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: The trap drove on, and a few minutes later we saw a sudden light spring up among the trees as the lamp was lit in one of the sitting-rooms.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Do you know, Watson,” said Holmes as we sat together in the gathering darkness, “I have really some scruples as to taking you to-night. There is a distinct element of danger.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Can I be of assistance?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Your presence might be invaluable.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Then I shall certainly come.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “It is very kind of you.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “You speak of danger. You have evidently seen more in these rooms than was visible to me.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “No, but I fancy that I may have deduced a little more. I imagine that you saw all that I did.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “I saw nothing remarkable save the bell-rope, and what purpose that could answer I confess is more than I can imagine.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “You saw the ventilator, too?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Yes, but I do not think that it is such a very unusual thing to have a small opening between two rooms. It was so small that a rat could hardly pass through.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “I knew that we should find a ventilator before ever we came to Stoke Moran.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “My dear Holmes!”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Oh, yes, I did. You remember in her statement she said that her sister could smell Dr. Roylott’s cigar.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: Now, of course that suggested at once that there must be a communication between the two rooms. It could only be a small one, or it would have been remarked upon at the coroner’s inquiry.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: I deduced a ventilator.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “But what harm can there be in that?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Well, there is at least a curious coincidence of dates. A ventilator is made, a cord is hung, and a lady who sleeps in the bed dies.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: Does not that strike you?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “I cannot as yet see any connection.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Did you observe anything very peculiar about that bed?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “No.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “It was clamped to the floor. Did you ever see a bed fastened like that before?”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “I cannot say that I have.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “The lady could not move her bed. It must always be in the same relative position to the ventilator and to the rope—or so we may call it, since it was clearly never meant for a bell-pull.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Holmes,” I cried, “I seem to see dimly what you are hinting at. We are only just in time to prevent some subtle and horrible crime.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “Subtle enough and horrible enough. When a doctor does go wrong he is the first of criminals.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: He has nerve and he has knowledge. Palmer and Pritchard were among the heads of their profession.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: This man strikes even deeper, but I think, Watson, that we shall be able to strike deeper still.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: But we shall have horrors enough before the night is over; for goodness’ sake let us have a quiet pipe and turn our minds for a few hours to something more cheerful.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: About nine o’clock the light among the trees was extinguished, and all was dark in the direction of the Manor House.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: Two hours passed slowly away, and then, suddenly, just at the stroke of eleven, a single bright light shone out right in front of us.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: “That is our signal,” said Holmes, springing to his feet; “it comes from the middle window.”
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: As we passed out he exchanged a few words with the landlord, explaining that we were going on a late visit to an acquaintance, and that it was possible that we might spend the night there.
scene_description: indoors, inn upper room, window view dusk, distant manor silhouette

segment_text: A moment later we were out on the dark road, a chill wind blowing in our faces, and one yellow light twinkling in front of us through the gloom to guide us on our sombre errand.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: There was little difficulty in entering the grounds, for unrepaired breaches gaped in the old park wall.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: Making our way among the trees, we reached the lawn, crossed it, and were about to enter through the window when out from a clump of laurel bushes there darted what seemed to be a hideous and distorted child, who threw itself upon the grass with writhing limbs and then ran swiftly across the lawn into the darkness.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: “My God!” I whispered; “did you see it?”
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: Holmes was for the moment as startled as I. His hand closed like a vice upon my wrist in his agitation.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: Then he broke into a low laugh and put his lips to my ear.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: “It is a nice household,” he murmured. “That is the baboon.”
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: I had forgotten the strange pets which the Doctor affected. There was a cheetah, too; perhaps we might find it upon our shoulders at any moment.
scene_description: nighttime, dark manor grounds, unrepaired park wall, laurel bushes

segment_text: I confess that I felt easier in my mind when, after following Holmes’ example and slipping off my shoes, I found myself inside the bedroom.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: My companion noiselessly closed the shutters, moved the lamp onto the table, and cast his eyes round the room.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: All was as we had seen it in the daytime. Then creeping up to me and making a trumpet of his hand, he whispered into my ear again so gently that it was all that I could do to distinguish the words:
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope
