segment_text: “The least sound would be fatal to our plans.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: I nodded to show that I had heard.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “We must sit without light. He would see it through the ventilator.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: I nodded again.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “Do not go asleep; your very life may depend upon it. Have your pistol ready in case we should need it.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: I will sit on the side of the bed, and you in that chair.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: I took out my revolver and laid it on the corner of the table.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Holmes had brought up a long thin cane, and this he placed upon the bed beside him. By it he laid the box of matches and the stump of a candle.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Then he turned down the lamp, and we were left in darkness.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: How shall I ever forget that dreadful vigil? I could not hear a sound, not even the drawing of a breath, and yet I knew that my companion sat open-eyed, within a few feet of me, in the same state of nervous tension in which I was myself.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: The shutters cut off the least ray of light, and we waited in absolute darkness.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: From outside came the occasional cry of a night-bird, and once at our very window a long drawn catlike whine, which told us that the cheetah was indeed at liberty.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Far away we could hear the deep tones of the parish clock, which boomed out every quarter of an hour. How long they seemed, those quarters!
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Twelve struck, and one and two and three, and still we sat waiting silently for whatever might befall.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Suddenly there was the momentary gleam of a light up in the direction of the ventilator, which vanished immediately, but was succeeded by a strong smell of burning oil and heated metal.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Someone in the next room had lit a dark-lantern. I heard a gentle sound of movement, and then all was silent once more, though the smell grew stronger.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: For half an hour I sat with straining ears. Then suddenly another sound became audible—a very gentle, soothing sound, like that of a small jet of steam escaping continually from a kettle.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: The instant that we heard it, Holmes sprang from the bed, struck a match, and lashed furiously with his cane at the bell-pull.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “You see it, Watson?” he yelled. “You see it?”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: But I saw nothing. At the moment when Holmes struck the light I heard a low, clear whistle, but the sudden glare flashing into my weary eyes made it impossible for me to tell what it was at which my friend lashed so savagely.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: I could, however, see that his face was deadly pale and filled with horror and loathing.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: He had ceased to strike and was gazing up at the ventilator when suddenly there broke from the silence of the night the most horrible cry to which I have ever listened.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: It swelled up louder and louder, a hoarse yell of pain and fear and anger all mingled in the one dreadful shriek.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: They say that away down in the village, and even in the distant parsonage, that cry raised the sleepers from their beds.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: It struck cold to our hearts, and I stood gazing at Holmes, and he at me, until the last echoes of it had died away into the silence from which it rose.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “What can it mean?” I gasped.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: “It means that it is all over,” Holmes answered. “And perhaps, after all, it is for the best.
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: Take your pistol, and we will enter Dr. Roylott’s room.”
scene_description: indoors, old country bedroom, low ceiling, gaping fireplace, bell-rope

segment_text: With a grave face he lit the lamp and led the way down the corridor.
scene_description: indoors, whitewashed manor corridor, small high windows, panelled doors

segment_text: Twice he struck at the chamber door without any reply from within.
scene_description: indoors, whitewashed manor corridor, small high windows, panelled doors

segment_text: Then he turned the handle and entered, I at his heels, with the cocked pistol in my hand.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: It was a singular sight which met our eyes.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: On the table stood a dark-lantern with the shutter half open, throwing a brilliant beam of light upon the iron safe, the door of which was ajar.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Beside this table, on the wooden chair, sat Dr. Grimesby Roylott clad in a long grey dressing-gown, his bare ankles protruding beneath, and his feet thrust into red heelless Turkish slippers.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Across his lap lay the short stock with the long lash which we had noticed during the day.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: His chin was cocked upward and his eyes were fixed in a dreadful, rigid stare at the corner of the ceiling.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Round his brow he had a peculiar yellow band, with brownish speckles, which seemed to be bound tightly round his head.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: As we entered he made neither sound nor motion.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “The band! the speckled band!” whispered Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: I took a step forward. In an instant his strange headgear began to move, and there reared itself from among his hair the squat diamond-shaped head and puffed neck of a loathsome serpent.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: “It is a swamp adder!” cried Holmes; “the deadliest snake in India.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: He has died within ten seconds of being bitten. Violence does, in truth, recoil upon the violent, and the schemer falls into the pit which he digs for another.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Let us thrust this creature back into its den, and we can then remove Miss Stoner to some place of shelter and let the county
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: police know what has happened.” As he spoke he drew the dog-whip swiftly from the dead man’s lap, and throwing the noose round the reptile’s neck he drew it from its horrid perch and, carrying it at arm’s length, threw it into the iron safe, which he closed upon it.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: Such are the true facts of the death of Dr. Grimesby Roylott, of Stoke Moran. It is not necessary that I should prolong a narrative which has already run to too great a length by telling how we broke the sad news to the terrified girl, how we conveyed her by the morning train to the care of her good aunt at Harrow, of how the slow process of official inquiry came to the conclusion that the doctor met his fate while indiscreetly playing with a dangerous pet.
scene_description: indoors, plain furnished bedroom, iron safe, round table, camp-bed

segment_text: The little which I had yet to learn of the case was told me by Sherlock Holmes as we travelled back next day.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: “I had,” said he, “come to an entirely erroneous conclusion which shows, my dear Watson, how dangerous it always is to reason from insufficient data.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The presence of the gipsies, and the use of the word ‘band,’ which was used by the poor girl, no doubt, to explain the appearance which she had caught a hurried glimpse of by the light of her match, were sufficient to put me upon an entirely wrong scent.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: I can only claim the merit that I instantly reconsidered my position when, however, it became clear to me that whatever danger threatened an occupant of the room could not come either from the window or the door.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: My attention was speedily drawn, as I have already remarked to you, to this ventilator, and to the bell-rope which hung down to the bed.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The discovery that this was a dummy, and that the bed was clamped to the floor, instantly gave rise to the suspicion that the rope was there as a bridge for something passing through the hole and coming to the bed.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The idea of a snake instantly occurred to me, and when I coupled it with my knowledge that the doctor was furnished with a supply of creatures from India, I felt that I was probably on the right track.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The idea of using a form of poison which could not possibly be discovered by any chemical test was just such a one as would occur to a clever and ruthless man who had had an Eastern training.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The rapidity with which such a poison would take effect would also, from his point of view, be an advantage. It would be a sharp-eyed coroner, indeed, who could distinguish the two little dark punctures which would show where the poison fangs had done their work.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: Then I thought of the whistle. Of course he must recall the snake before the morning light revealed it to the victim.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: He had trained it, probably by the use of the milk which we saw, to return to him when summoned. He would put it through this ventilator at the hour that he thought best, with the certainty that it would crawl down the rope and land on the bed.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: It might or might not bite the occupant, perhaps she might escape every night for a week, but sooner or later she must fall a victim.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: “I had come to these conclusions before ever I had entered his room. An inspection of his chair showed me that he had been in the habit of standing on it, which of course would be necessary in order that he should reach the ventilator.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The sight of the safe, the saucer of milk, and the loop of whipcord were enough to finally dispel any doubts which may have remained.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: The metallic clang heard by Miss Stoner was obviously caused by her stepfather hastily closing the door of his safe upon its terrible occupant.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: Having once made up my mind, you know the steps which I took in order to put the matter to the proof. I heard the creature hiss as I have no doubt that you did also, and I instantly lit the light and attacked it.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: “With the result of driving it through the ventilator.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: “And also with the result of causing it to turn upon its master at the other side. Some of the blows of my cane came home and roused its snakish temper, so that it flew upon the first person it saw.
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight

segment_text: In this way I am no doubt indirectly responsible for Dr. Grimesby Roylott’s death, and I cannot say that it is likely to weigh very heavily upon my conscience.”
scene_description: indoors, train carriage interior, passing countryside, daylight
